thread.title: Homecoming finale for Hampshire band's tour
thread.title_full: Homecoming finale for Hampshire band's tour

title: Homecoming finale for Hampshire band's tour
text:
0 comments 
EASTLEIGH band Three Times Over have announced a brand new tour to support the release of their new EP in December, which ends with a triumphant show in Southampton . 
The five-piece band have had an exciting year already performing to fans at local venues such at the Talking Heads and the Joiners in Southampton as well as several national venues. 
In the summer, the lads performed alongside The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus, an American alternative metal band based in Florida, at the Joiners as well as performing in front of thousands at the Wellies and Wristbands festival. 
The boys have been busy recording and completing their new EP Pathways in time for the upcoming release tour and have recently welcomed new guitarist Andy Towell so that lead singer Mike Guyan can focus on vocals. 
Three Times Over begin their five date tour in Brighton on December 2 as they perform on the same stage as such acts as The Kooks, Ben Howard and Rizzle Kicks. Share article 
A further four tour dates back to back will then commence with the pop punk band heading to Guildford, London and Leicester before they finish their EP tour at Southampton's Joiners in front of their home crowd. 
Guildford 'soul-ternative' rock band Cavalier with be joining Three Times Over for the tour with alternative rock/electro band More Than Most also supporting them on the last three dates of the tour.
